docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 16 President Carter's diplomatic representatives are seeking to promote respect for human rights in South America by working through the existing military regimes, not against them.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 16 President Carter's diplomatic representatives are seeking to promote respect for human rights in South America by working through the existing military regimes, not against them.
docs.abstract: US Asst Sec Terence A Todman, now on tour of Chile, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, is stressing recent improvements in observance of human rights; has noted Pres Carter's concern for human rights is not aimed against any particular govt and that US is not trying to dictate conduct on human rights or pol liberties to other countries; Todman and State Dept official Patricia Derian have made clear to Argentine and Uruguayan authorities that US is monitoring charges of continuing aribtrary arrest, disappearances, torture and intimidation; Todman, Derian and Allard K Lowenstein have met with opposition leaders, union officials and RC and humanitarian groups in each country; US diplomatic sources say there is lively debate in State Dept over using econ sanctions against mil regimes that refuse to take measures to improve human rights or relax pol repression (M)

headline.main: U.S. RIGHTS DRIVE ASKS AID OF LATIN MILITARY; Easing of Repression Is Sought by Working Through Regimes Rather Than Against Them

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 17 (AP)-Assistant Secretary of State Terence Todman arrived here tonight after discussing human rights with Gen. Alfredo Stroessner, President of Paraguay.

docs.snippet: TORONTO, Aug. 17 (AP) John McEnroe, the Wimbledon sensation from Douglaston, Queens, advanced today to the second round of the Canadian open tennis tournament by defeating Werner Zirngibl of West Germany, 6-4, 2-6, 6-3.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs, Terence A. Todman, reported progress toward enhanced human rights in four South American countries under military control today but said each nation "still hs a...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Assistant Secretary of State for Inter-American Affairs, Terence A. Todman, reported progress toward enhanced human rights in four South American countries under military control today but said each nation "still hs a long way to go."

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 5 (AP) Amnesty International, a London-based organization that attempts to monitor human rights worldwide, today published a list of 62 legislators who, it says, have been imprisoned or have "disappeared" in 17 countries. It appealed to...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 5 (AP) Amnesty International, a London-based organization that attempts to monitor human rights worldwide, today published a list of 62 legislators who, it says, have been imprisoned or have "disappeared" in 17 countries. It appealed to legislative bodies to campaign for their release.
docs.abstract: Amnesty Internatl includes Benigno S Aquino in list of lawmakers detained in various nations (S)
